pulmonary.jugular_venous_pulse: 5 cm of water with normal contour
pulmonary.systolic_murmur: grade 1/6 at the left upper sternal border

neurological.sensation: Symmetric in left and right arms

physical_examinations.date: Two weeks after discharge (Not specified exact date)

neck_swelling.numbness: Residual numbness in tips of left third, fourth, and fifth digits

physical_examinations.date: Five days after the evaluation in the electrophysiology clinic (Not specified exact date)

symptoms.description: Recurrent swelling and pain in neck and supraclavicular region on left side; numbness and tingling in the face, shoulder, and arm on the left side; mild dysphagia; feeling of hotter left side face.

neurological.working_description: Reduced sensation in left trigeminal-nerve distribution and dysesthesia

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ultrasonography of the left side of the neck revealed no substantial change in the complex mass in the left supraclavicular region.
